sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: &app; allows allows you to display simple dialogs from the command line or from shell scripts.
The following list of dialogs are available with &app;:

listitem.para: Display a Calendar dialog.
Display a Text Entry dialog.
Display an Error dialog.
Display an Informational dialog.
Display a File Selection dialog.
Display a List dialog.
Display a Progress dialog.
Display a Question dialog.
Display a Text Information dialog.
Display a Warning dialog.

sect1.title: Basic Use
sect1.para: &app; can only be used to create relatively simple dialogs, but is especially useful when used in scripts. When a user has completed an action requested of them, and the dialog closes, &app; prints any text specific to the dialog to standard error and an exit code is returned. Information about what text is printed to standard error will be detailed in the individual dialog sections.
The following exit codes are observed by &app;:

listitem.para: The user has pressed either 'OK' or 'Close'.
The user has pressed either 'Cancel' or closed the dialog through the window functions.
An unexpected error has occurred.

sect1.title: General Options
sect1.para: Each dialog shares some general command line options. If these are not provided, there are some default values that depend on the type of dialog being displayed.
The following list of general options are available:

listitem.para: Specify the title of a dialog.
Specify the icon that should appear in the window frame of the dialog.

sect1.title: Calendar
sect1.para: To create a Calendar dialog, use --calendar. &app; will return the date selected to standard error. The following list of options are also available for the Calendar dialog:

listitem.para: Specify the text to appear in the Calendar dialog.
Specify the day to be pre-selected in the Calendar dialog. This must be a number between 1 and 31.
Specify the day to be pre-selected in the Calendar dialog. This must be a number between 1 and 12.
Specify the year to be pre-selected in the Calendar dialog.
Specify the format to be returned from the Calendar dialog after the selection has been made. This defaults to a format depending on your locale. The format must be of strftime style eg. "%A %d/%m%y"

sect1.title: Text Entry
sect1.para: To create a Text Entry dialog, use --text-entry. &app; returns the contents of the text entry to standard error. The following list of options are also available for the Text Entry dialog:

listitem.para: Specify the text to appear in the Text Entry dialog.
Specify the text to appear in the entry field of the Text Entry dialog.
Specify that the text in the entry field of the Text Entry dialog be hidden.

sect1.title: Messages
sect1.para: There are 4 types of message dialogs in &app; - Error, Informational, Question and Warning. To create an Error dialog, use --error. To create an Informational dialog, use --info. To create a Question dialog, use --question. To create a Warning dialog, use --question. The following list of options is available for the message dialogs.

listitem.para: Specify the text to appear in the message dialog.

sect1.title: File Selection
sect1.para: To create a File Selection dialog, use --file-selection. &app; returns the file or directory selected to standard error. The following list of options are also available for the File Selection dialog:

listitem.para: Specify the file or directory to be pre-selected in the File Selection dialog.

sect1.title: Lists
sect1.para: To create a List dialog, use --list. &app; returns the entries of the first columns selected to standard error. If --checklist or --radiolist is used, then &app; will return the entries of the second columns selected to standard error. The following list of options are also available for the File Selection dialog:

listitem.para: Specify the column headers to appear in the List dialog. This option must be called for each column that you want to appear in the dialog.
Specify if the first column should contain check boxes in the List dialog.
Specify if the first column should contain radio boxes in the List dialog.
Specify what seperator character should be used when the List dialog returns the selected entries. The default character is '\'. If you want to specify a newline, use '\n'.

sect1.title: Progress
sect1.para: To create a Progress dialog, use --progress. The following list of options are also available for the Progress dialog:

listitem.para: Specify the text to appear in the Progress dialog.
Specify the initial percentage that should be set in the Progress dialog.
Specify if the Progress dialog should pulsate until an EOF character is read from standard input.

sect1.title: Text Information
sect1.para: To create a Text Information dialog, use --text-info. The following list of options are also available for the Text Information dialog:

listitem.para: Specify the file to be loaded in the Text Information dialog.

sect1.title: Miscellaneous
sect1.para: The following list of options are also available for &app;:

listitem.para: Display some information about &app;.
Print the version number of &app;.
